sub_title: Customer Experience Manager  at T-Mobile Nederland
summary:
As a Senior engineer I am used to acquire customer needs, define and analyze requirements, develop product concepts and bring suitable solutions in the area of mobile communications technologies. Cost modeling of telecom networks and services from a Regulatory point of view represents the second pillar of my background.

My career path has consistently brought me in direct contact with large and complex corporate databases, applications and processes. As owner, architect, manager, power user or analyst, depending on the position and system. Yet always striving for an as simplified as possible, consistent and harmonized operating enterprise.

Being customer and result oriented is key to me. I take complex or unknown systems, technologies or issues as a challenge. I can solve problems or find solutions independently but the best comes out of me while working with others in a team. My track record includes coordination of different international expert teams and communication with different internal and external stakeholders.

My goal is getting closer to the business side while profiting from my technical and analytical background to bridge across different enterprise areas. I am looking for a position in a customer oriented environment where I can apply my abilities in the definition, development, introduction and integration of new systems, processes or services, as well as my analysis and optimization skills to improve the existing ones.

I feel comfortable working with different people and establishing new contacts. Therefore I am looking forward to be involved in dealing with business partners in order to establish optimal long term solutions for customers.

Specialties: Mobile telecommunications. Analysis, solutions, integration, requirements definition, product and process development,  customer oriented, complex systems, team member, open, flexible. International, Spanish, English, Dutch and French.

profile_positions.description:
Being part of the Quality Assurance team, the overall goal is ensuring the end-to-end performance and quality of all the company’s service portfolio, doing that in close cooperation with Business and Technology.

The Service Intelligence Expert:
.- Executes service performance management and data mining activities to enable forensic analysis
.- Initiates corrective and preventive actions and facilitate improvement plans.
.- Analyses and correlates data from different sources, to identify issues and provide root cause analysis.
.- Is the driver of Customer Experience Management in technology, ensuring that the customer touch points are measured from a customer perspective covering all aspects like services, devices and apps.
.- Manages the customer experience applications which are functionally owned by Service Intelligence.
profile_positions.title: Customer Experience Manager (Senior)

profile_positions.description:
At the core of the Idea-to-Market chain and managing the product life cycle, the main responsibilities are:
.- Product catalogue management: create and modify commercial offers, including product specification and pricing.
.- Business rules management: create and modify the product offerings eligibility and compatibility rules.
Implementing the optimal ordering process in the IT stack, spanning from front-end (customer facing) to back-end (CRM and billing) applications, including communication towards the customer.
Product launch, retirement and out-phasing.
.- Analysis and resolution of product configuration related incidents
.- Advice and support on the product and price implementation process.
.- Interfacing with the corporate IT organisation.
profile_positions.title: Product Configuration Analyst

profile_positions.description:
Defining and safeguarding blueprints.
Data governance:
o	Data architecture and integration: ensuring consistency and reducing complexity
o	Managing information as a corporate asset.
Evaluating and monitoring project/program dependencies.
Bridging to ensure alignment and consistency amongst parties and projects or programs.
Facilitating an open, modular, layered, reusable and resilient architecture.

Working language: English, Dutch, French
profile_positions.title: Enterprise Architect

profile_positions.description:
The major tasks to perform as a Network economics specialist are:

Provide costing information services to the regulatory department of Belgacom Group related to the group’s IP and Fixed-Mobile converging networks. 

Develop and maintain proficiency on next generation and converging network technologies and topologies of the Belgacom Group.

Develop and maintain models calculating and reporting on investment and operational costs of the next generation network (Broadband IP,VoIP, iDTV,VPN) and fix-wireless converging networks.

Establish relationships between network costs and retail/wholesale products of the group.

Produce reliable unit cost data of fixed and mobile network components and of retail /wholesale products.

Produce reliable and auditable documentation of the above costing models and costing relationships and be accountable in case of external audit. 

Detect impact of Belgacom Group’s strategic decisions on network and product costing aspects.

Provide assistance to regulatory experts and advisors in the domain of network costing and network sizing.

Working languages: English, Dutch and French
Brussels, Belgium
profile_positions.title: Network Economics Specialist

Access Network Engineering Department

.- Performing impact analysis of new features/systems/services introduction.
.- Analyzing and reporting on performance data. Troubleshooting
Working language: English
The Hague, The Netherlands.
